intro: Pycreus vicinus, commonly known as the slender pycreus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Pycreus vicinus is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
